title: Water flow into a tank: rate in/rate out

content.description: During the time interval <math> <mrow> <mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>4.5</mn></mrow> </math> hours, water flows into tank A at a rate of <math> <mrow> <mi>a</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mn>2</mn><mi>t</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>+</mo><mn>5</mn><msup> <mi>e</mi> <mrow> <mn>2</mn><mi>sin</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow> </msup> </mrow> </math> liters per hour. During the same time interval, water flows into tank B at a rate of b(t) liters per hour. Both tanks are empty at time t = 0. The graphs of y = a(t) and y = b(t), shown in the figure above, intersect at t = k and t = 2.416.
content.question: During the time interval <math> <mrow> <mn>2.7</mn> <mo>≤</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>≤</mo> <mn>4.5</mn> </mrow> </math> hours, the rate at which water flows into tank B is modeled by <math> <mrow> <mi>w</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>=</mo> <mn>21</mn> <mo>−</mo> <mfrac> <mrow> <mn>30</mn> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <msup> <mrow> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mi>t</mi> <mo>−</mo> <mn>8</mn> </mrow> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> <mn>2</mn> </msup> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> </math> liters per hour. Is the difference w(t) - a(t) increasing or decreasing at time t = 3.5 ? Show the work that leads to your answer.

frqParts.text: During the time interval <math> <mrow> <mn>2.7</mn> <mo>≤</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>≤</mo> <mn>4.5</mn> </mrow> </math> hours, the rate at which water flows into tank B is modeled by <math> <mrow> <mi>w</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>=</mo> <mn>21</mn> <mo>−</mo> <mfrac> <mrow> <mn>30</mn> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <msup> <mrow> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mi>t</mi> <mo>−</mo> <mn>8</mn> </mrow> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> <mn>2</mn> </msup> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> </math> liters per hour. Is the difference w(t) - a(t) increasing or decreasing at time t = 3.5 ? Show the work that leads to your answer.

topic.text: 5.3: Determining Intervals on Which a Function Is Increasing or Decreasing

skill.text: Skill 2.E: Describe the relationships among different representations of functions and their derivatives.
